CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management – Forensic evidence (U.S. Government clouds)
CurrentVersion.description: The forensic evidence capability is an opt-in add-in to Insider Risk Management, helping customers’ security teams get visual insights into potentially risky user actions that might lead to a data security incident. Forensic evidence is off by default and policy creation requires dual authorization. Customers determine what triggers the feature and manage investigation processes. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy. Note: The roadmap item was inadvertently marked rolling out and has now been updated to reflect the current release phase. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

OldVersion.description: The forensic evidence capability is an opt-in add-in to Insider Risk Management, helping customers’ security teams get visual insights into potentially risky user actions that might lead to a data security incident. Forensic evidence is off by default and policy creation requires dual authorization. Customers determine what triggers the feature and manage investigation processes. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy. Note: The roadmap item was inadvertently marked rolling out and has now been updated to reflect the current release phase. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Email and associated entities hunting capabilities available through Microsoft Graph Security API
CurrentVersion.description:
,
We are introducing email and associated entities hunting capabilities to the Microsoft Graph Security API. Email meta data like email properties (subject, sender, domain etc ), MDO detections, and related entities can now be hunt via the API.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Email and associated entities hunting capabilities available through Microsoft Graph Security API
OldVersion.description:
,We are introducing email and associated entities
hunting capabilities to the Microsoft Graph Security API. Email meta data like
email properties (subject, sender, domain etc ), MDO detections, and related
entities can now be hunt via the API.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: New Outlook for Windows and web - Reading pane background image
CurrentVersion.description: To offer more personalization to end users, Outlook on the web and the new Outlook for Windows will now have the ability to display a background image in the reading pane whenever emails are not selected. This feature will be turned off by default for commercial customers. A user will be able to turn on a background image by going to Settings >> General>> Appearance from Outlook.

OldVersion.title: Outlook: New Outlook for Windows and web - Reading pane background image
OldVersion.description:
To offer more personalization to end users,
Outlook on the web and the new Outlook for Windows will now have the ability to
display a background image in the reading pane whenever emails are not
selected. This feature will be turned off by default for commercial customers.
A user will be able to turn on a background image by going to Settings 
General Appearance from Outlook.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Walkie Talkie: automatically listen to multiple channels
CurrentVersion.description: Walkie Talkie, a push-to-talk experience that enables clear and secure voice communication over the cloud, enables teams to communicate instantly on a channel. Through this new functionality, users can now connect to, up to 5 favorite channels in multi-channel mode, automatically listen to incoming transmission from these favorited channels and initiate easily initiate PTT transmission on these channels.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Walkie Talkie: automatically listen to multiple channels
OldVersion.description:
Walkie Talkie, a push-to-talk experience that enables
clear and secure voice communication over the cloud, enables teams to
communicate instantly on a channel. Through this new functionality, users can
now connect to, up to 5 favorite channels in multi-channel mode, automatically
listen to incoming transmission from these favorited channels and initiate
easily initiate PTT transmission on these channels.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Syntex: Translation
CurrentVersion.description: A new service that enables users to translate documents quickly and accurately among dozens of languages based on specific metadata or on-demand.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Syntex: Translation
OldVersion.description: A new service that enables users to translate documents quickly and accurately among dozens of languages based on specific metadata or on-demand.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Branded Meetings - Join Launcher Screen with Brand Image and Logo Support (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: The Teams Join Launcher web page will now support the brand logo and brand image uploaded for branded meetings. This is a Teams Premium feature.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Branded Meetings - Join Launcher Screen with Brand Image and Logo Support (Premium)
OldVersion.description:
The Teams Join
Launcher web page will now support the brand logo and brand image uploaded for
branded meetings. This is a Teams Premium feature.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention - Enhanced content extraction and file type coverage for DLP on Windows devices
CurrentVersion.description:
,
With this release, the file type coverage to scan, classify and protect sensitive content on windows endpoint devices with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention policies will increase from current ~40 file types to 100+ file types. This release will make the coverage of file types on endpoint consistent with other locations such as Exchange, SharePoint, and OneDrive. This will also include other enhancements like detecting label from pfile, detecting sensitive content in metadata, and detecting sensitive content in PDF forms.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Endpoint Data Loss Prevention - Enhanced file type coverage for DLP on Windows endpoints
OldVersion.description:
,
With this release, the file type coverage to scan, classify and protect sensitive content on windows endpoint devices with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention policies will increase from current ~40 file types to 100+ file types. This release will make the coverage of file types on endpoint consistent with other locations such as Exchange, SharePoint, and OneDrive. This will also include other enhancements like detecting label from pfile, detecting sensitive content in metadata, and detecting sensitive content in PDF forms.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Multi-instance app customization support for Teams apps
CurrentVersion.description: IT admin has the ability to customize Teams apps to align with the company’s brand and enhance their usefulness for employees. By creating and managing multiple customized app instances, it can improve branding, awareness, and user engagement, overcomes the limitations of a single-instance approach and enables greater adaptability to meet the diverse business needs.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Multi-instance app customization support for Teams apps
OldVersion.description:
IT
admin has the ability to customize Teams apps to align with the company’s brand
and enhance their usefulness for employees. By creating and managing multiple
customized app instances, it can improve branding, awareness, and user
engagement, overcomes the limitations of a single-instance approach and enables
greater adaptability to meet the diverse business needs.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teachers can (manually) update parent data in Parent App
CurrentVersion.description: Allow teachers to add and edit existing parent data inside the Parent app. This request to update parent information can be directly made by teachers inside the Parent app. Once the request is raised, it needs an admin approval before updating the parent information in the app.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Teachers can (manually) update parent data in Parent App
OldVersion.description: Allow teachers to add and edit existing parent data inside the Parent app. This request to update parent information can be directly made by teachers inside the Parent app. Once the request is raised, it needs an admin approval before updating the parent information in the app.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Assign staff and set duration for on-demand Virtual Appointments (Premium)
CurrentVersion.description: Scheduling administrators and staff managing on-demand appointments can assign specific staff members and set appointment duration to handle on-demand services. This ensures that when an on-demand appointment is requested, there is a designated staff member assigned to the appointment and a defined duration for the appointment is set. The designated staff member also receives a notification to attend the on-demand appointment.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Assign staff and set duration for on-demand Virtual Appointments (Premium)
OldVersion.description: Scheduling administrators and staff managing on-demand appointments can assign specific staff members and set appointment duration to handle on-demand services. This ensures that when an on-demand appointment is requested, there is a designated staff member assigned to the appointment and a defined duration for the appointment is set. The designated staff member also receives a notification to attend the on-demand appointment.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Microsoft Teams admin center - external domain activity report
CurrentVersion.description: The external domain activity report will show Teams administrators which domains their users communicate with. Available for both those with open federation on and those with explicit allow lists.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Microsoft Teams admin center - external domain activity report
OldVersion.description: The external domain activity report will show Teams administrators which domains their users communicate with. Available for both those with open federation on and those with explicit allow lists.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Tags will be supported in Private Channels
CurrentVersion.description: Users can now use team tags to @ mention groups of people in private channels.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Tags will be supported in Private Channels
OldVersion.description: Users can now use team tags to @ mention groups of people in private channels.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Microsoft Edge for Business - Enable organizational branding
CurrentVersion.description:
Enable your organization's branding assets from Entra onto profile-related UI for profiles signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. You can add your organization’s details such as name to the profile pill, name and brand color to the profile flyout, and logo to overlay the Edge for Business taskbar icon. This branding can help users more easily differentiate between multiple profiles and browser windows. Default organizational branding can be enabled by admins through the following policies: OrganizationalBrandingOnWorkProfileUIEnabled and OrganizationLogoOverlayOnAppIconEnabled. Admins will need to have 'company branding' assets configured in the Microsoft Entra admin center for branding assets to be applied to this feature.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-for-business#company-branding

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: v.121 Enable organizational branding in Edge for Business
OldVersion.description:
Enable your organization's branding assets from Entra onto profile-related UI for profiles signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. You can add your organization’s details such as name to the profile pill, name and brand color to the profile flyout, and logo to overlay the Edge for Business taskbar icon. This branding can help users more easily differentiate between multiple profiles and browser windows. Default organizational branding can be enabled by admins through the following policies: OrganizationalBrandingOnWorkProfileUIEnabled and OrganizationLogoOverlayOnAppIconEnabled. Admins will need to have 'company branding' assets configured in the Microsoft Entra admin center for branding assets to be applied to this feature.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-for-business#company-branding

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Create more than one Connections experience in the same tenant
CurrentVersion.description: This new capability enables customers to create multiple distinct Connections experiences and corresponding home sites within the same tenant. Common scenarios include conglomerates or subsidiaries that require different Connections experiences for different users, each with its own dashboard, feed and resources.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Viva: Create more than one Connections experience in the same tenant
OldVersion.description: This new capability enables customers to create multiple distinct Connections experiences and corresponding home sites within the same tenant. Common scenarios include conglomerates or subsidiaries that require different Connections experiences for different users, each with its own dashboard, feed and resources.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Microsoft Edge for Business - Customize organizational branding using Edge Management Service
CurrentVersion.description:
Admins can customize their organization's branding assets through Microsoft Edge management service onto Edge for Business. Admins can enable and configure branding onto profile-related UI for profiles signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. You can configure your organization’s details such as name to the profile pill; name, logo, and brand color to the profile flyout; and logo to overlay the Edge for Business taskbar icon. This branding can help users more easily differentiate between multiple profiles and browser windows. This Microsoft Edge management service will give admins an enhanced experience to control, preview, and customize assets.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-for-business#company-branding

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Customize organization branding in Edge for Business
OldVersion.description:
Admins can customize their organization's branding assets onto Edge for Business. Admins can enable and configure branding onto profile-related UI for profiles signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. You can configure your organization’s details such as name to the profile pill; name, logo, and brand color to the profile flyout; and logo to overlay the Edge for Business taskbar icon. This branding can help users more easily differentiate between multiple profiles and browser windows. This Microsoft Edge management service will give admins an enhanced experience to control, preview, and customize assets.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-for-business#company-branding

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Quicker sign in without entering the domain name
CurrentVersion.description: Users can skip typing the full user principal name (UPN) and sign in faster on shared and managed devices, by using app configuration policies to autofill the domain name.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Quicker sign in without entering the domain name
OldVersion.description: Users can skip typing the full user principal name (UPN) and sign in faster on shared and managed devices, by using app configuration policies to autofill the domain name.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Audit - New filters in Audit Search
CurrentVersion.description: ,Audit Search allows customers to retrieve audit logs relevant to a security or compliance investigation. With this change, customers will now be able to search for relevant audit logs using additional fields such as ObjectId, UserKey, UserType, IP Address, DocumentId, SiteId, and AppId.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Stream: Record a new video on the Stream Start page in Office for Government clouds
CurrentVersion.description: Users can create a new video directly from the Stream Start page in Office web by recording their webcam and/or screen. The new video is uploaded to OneDrive and ready to share.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Stream: Record a new video on the Stream Start page in Office for Government clouds
OldVersion.description: Users can create a new video directly from the Stream Start page in Office web by recording their webcam and/or screen. The new video is uploaded to OneDrive and ready to share.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Live Share SDK support for meeting extensions
CurrentVersion.description:
Live Share is a new developer capability designed to transform Teams meeting apps into collaborative multi-user experiences without writing any dedicated back-end code. Live Share SDK support for meeting extensions enables general-purpose collaboration features, turn-key media synchronization to co-watch videos in meetings, and inking, cursors & annotations.


More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/apps-in-teams-meetings/teams-live-share-overview?tabs=javascript

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Live Share SDK support for meeting extensions
OldVersion.description:
Live Share is a new developer capability designed to transform Teams meeting apps into collaborative multi-user experiences without writing any dedicated back-end code. Live Share SDK support for meeting extensions enables general-purpose collaboration features, turn-key media synchronization to co-watch videos in meetings, and inking, cursors & annotations.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/apps-in-teams-meetings/teams-live-share-overview?tabs=javascript
